activities: II. Member of a managing entity or equivalent structure
III. Member of a scientific advisory entity
Bundesinstitut für Risikobewertung (BfR) in Berlin, (DE): Bundesinstitut für Risikobewertung (BfR) in Berlin, Berlin, GERMANY
BfR: since 2014 member of the commission "food additives, aromatics, and food processing".(1-2 meetings planned per year)
III. Member of a scientific advisory entity
Austrian Ministry of Health, D: Österreichisches Bundesministerium für Gesundheit, Vienna, AUSTRIA

Austrian Ministry of Health: Since 2013 member of the commissions "codex alimentarius austriacus" (~ 2meetings/yr) and "novel food" (~2 meetings/yr). In the commission "Codex alimantarius.." the advice comprises occasional consultancy with regard to risk assessment of food and feed contaminants. In the other commission I contribute to the decision finding of the commission with regard to risks of the application of genetically modified organisms for the safety of food and feed. Since December 2014 member of a working group with the purpose to give scientfic advice with regard to the risks of the electronic cigarette (first meeting in December 2014; next planned for February 2015).
Medical University of Vienna (MUW), Medizinische Universität Wien, Vienna, AUSTRIA

Employed as senior scientist at the Institute of Cancer Research; head of the research unit "Chemical Safety and Cancer Prevention". Research focus: chemical carcinogenesis, non-genotoxic carcinogenesis and tumor promotion in the liver, chemoprevention, peroxidized lipid and induction of hepatic inflammation; development of alternatives to animal bioassays, epithelial-mesenchymal interactions in the liver; the role of fibroblast growth factors for hepatocarcinogenesis. For further details see: http://krebsforschung.meduniwien.ac.at/forschung-research/research- focus/chemical-safety-and-cancer-prevention/bettina-grasl-kraupp-ao- univ-prof-dr/?L=1 Director of the postgraduate course Toxicology at the Medial University Vienna. For details see: http://www.meduniwien.ac.at/toxicology/php/index.php
Umweltbundesamt GmbH , Austrian Federal Environment Agency Ltd, AUSTRIA, Vienna
Occasional consultancy with regard to the human biomonitoring programme of this agency
European Commission/Innovative Medicine Initiative, Austrian Science Fonds

EU-project in the frame of the Innovative Medicine Initiative (IMI) details see: www.imi-marcar.eu/. In this project two PhD students and 2 technicians, working in my group, are receiving funding. A further project is funded by the Austrian Science Fonds (www.fwf.ac.at). One phd student and several diploma students in my group are paid from this source.
